slam.data_manager.factory.batch module

class slam.data_manager.factory.batch.DataBatch[source]

Bases: object

DataBatch is a container for data.

property data: deque[Element]

Elements in the data batch.

property first: Element

The first element of the batch.

property size_bytes: int

The size of the batch in bytes. Not implemented.

add(new_element: Element) → None[source]

Adds new element to the Batch.

Parameters:

new_element – element to be added.

remove_first() → None[source]

Deletes the first(left) element of the batch.

remove_last() → None[source]

Deletes the last(right) element of the batch.

sort(reverse: bool = False) → None[source]

Sorts the data batch by timestamps.

Parameters:

reverse – if True, sorts in descending order.

empty() → bool[source]

Checks if the batch is empty.

clear() → None[source]

Deletes all elements of the batch.

Creates a new Data Batch from the dataset.

@overload.

Creates a new Data Batch for the collections of elements.

@overload.

save_batch() → None[source]

Saves the Data Batch. Not implemented.

static _data_processed() → None[source]

Changes the stopping criterion when all data has been processed and logs the message.

static _memory_limit_reached() → None[source]

Changes the stopping criterion when the memory limit has been reached and logs the message.

_limitation() → bool[source]

Checks if any limitation has been reached to stop the creation of a new element for the Data Batch and returns stopping criterion status.

_add_data() → None[source]
_add_data(no_data_element: Element) → None
_add_data(request: PeriodicDataRequest) → None

@overload.

Adds new element to the DataBatch.

_add_data(self, no_data_element: slam.data_manager.factory.element.Element) → NoneType[source]

@overload.

Adds a new element to the Data Batch based on the requested Element w/o raw sensor measurement.

Parameters:

no_data_element – element w/o raw sensor measurement.

_add_data(self, request: slam.utils.auxiliary_dataclasses.PeriodicDataRequest) → NoneType[source]

@overload.

Adds a new element to the Data Batch based on the request.

Attention: start/stop timestamps must be valid,

exist in a dataset and correspond to real measurements.

Parameters:

request – sensor and time range of measurements to be added to the Data Batch.

Raises:

StopIteration – if the element for the given sensor and “start” timestamp does not exist.

slam.data_manager.factory.data_reader_ABC module

class slam.data_manager.factory.data_reader_ABC.DataFlowState[source]

Bases: ABC

Keeps up-to-date state of iterators for a data reader.

Should be implemented for each reader.

class slam.data_manager.factory.data_reader_ABC.DataReader(regime: Stream | TimeLimit, dataset_params: DatasetConfig)[source]

Bases: ABC

Parameters:

  • regime – data flow regime.

  • dataset_params – parameters of the dataset.

Checks if the file is valid: exists and not empty.

get_element() → Element | None[source]
get_element(sensor: Sensor) → Element | None
get_element(element: Element) → Element
get_element(sensor: Sensor, timestamp: int) → Element

@overload.

Gets element from a dataset sequentially based on iterator position.

Returns:

element with raw measurement or None if all measurements from a dataset has already been processed.

get_element(self, sensor: slam.setup_manager.sensors_factory.sensors.Sensor) → slam.data_manager.factory.element.Element | None[source]

@overload.

Gets element from a dataset sequentially based on iterator position for the specific sensor.

Parameters:

sensor – a sensor to get measurement of.

Returns:

element with raw measurement or None if all measurements from a dataset has already been processed.

get_element(self, element: slam.data_manager.factory.element.Element) → slam.data_manager.factory.element.Element[source]

@overload.

Gets the element with raw measurement from a dataset for the given element without raw measurement.

Parameters:

element (Element) – without raw measurement.

Returns:

element with raw measurement.

Raises:

ItemNotFoundError – the given element is not in the dataset.

get_element(self, sensor: slam.setup_manager.sensors_factory.sensors.Sensor, timestamp: int) → slam.data_manager.factory.element.Element[source]

@overload.

Gets an element with raw sensor measurement from a dataset for the given sensor and timestamp.

Parameters:

  • sensor (Sensor) – a sensor to get measurement of.

  • timestamp (int) – timestamp of sensor`s measurement.

Returns:

element with raw measurement.

Raises:

ItemNotFoundError – the element of the given sensor and timestamp is not in the dataset.

slam.data_manager.factory.data_reader_factory module

class slam.data_manager.factory.data_reader_factory.DataReaderFactory[source]

Bases: object

Factory for creating DataReader instance based on a dataset type.

static create_reader(dataset_cfg: DatasetConfig, regime_cfg: RegimeConfig) → DataReader[source]

Creates Data Reader based on dataset type.

Parameters:

  • dataset_cfg (DatasetConfig) – configuration of the dataset.

  • regime_cfg (RegimeConfig) – configuration of the data flow regime.

Raises:

  • ValueError – Invalid regime name.

  • NotImplementedError – No DataReader exists for the given dataset type.

slam.data_manager.factory.element module

class slam.data_manager.factory.element.RawMeasurement(sensor: Sensor, values: Any)[source]

Bases: object

Raw sensor measurement.

Hash() calculation ignores values because some of them might not be hashable, i.e. PIL.Image.

sensor: Sensor
values: Any
